channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Public school districts coast to coast adopting radical curriculum from org named for 60s radical
item.description: Controversial Zinn Education Project curriculum adopted by 176,000+ teachers nationwide teaches American history through lens of racial oppression in public schools.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Controversy over Tucker Carlson interview reveals conservative movement's conflict over antisemitism
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — As Republicans accuse Democrats of tolerating antisemitism in their party, the GOP on Friday was roiled by its own schism after the leader of a powerful right-wing think tank defended prominent conservative commentator Tucker Carlson for his friendly podcast interview with a far-righ
item.dc:creator: NICHOLAS RICCARDI, JILL COLVIN and THOMAS BEAUMONT, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Republican leaders reject Trump's demands to scrap the Senate filibuster to end the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Back from a week abroad, President Donald Trump threw himself into the shutdown debate, calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster and reopen the government, an idea swiftly rejected Friday by Republican leaders who have long opposed such a move.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO and MARY CLARE JALONICK, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Ramen instead of Reese's? Looming SNAP cuts change what's on offer for Halloween trick-or-treaters
item.description: When KC Neufeld announced on her Denver neighborhood’s Facebook page that her family would be handing out ramen and packs of macaroni and cheese in addition to candy this Halloween, she wasn't expecting much of a response.
item.dc:creator: HALLIE GOLDEN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Judge orders arrest of ex-Green Beret tied to failed Venezuela raid after court no-show
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — A federal judge in Tampa has ordered the arrest of a former Green Beret accused of plotting to invade Venezuela in 2020 after he failed to show up to court for a hearing on whether he should be taken back into custody for violating the conditions of his pre-trial release.
item.dc:creator: CURT ANDERSON and JOSHUA GOODMAN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, WGN 9

item.title: Monkey escape in Mississippi gives a glimpse into the secretive world of animal research
item.description: The recent escape of several research monkeys after the truck carrying them overturned on a Mississippi interstate is the latest glimpse into the secretive industry of animal research and the processes that allow key details of what happened to be kept from the public.
item.dc:creator: JEFF MARTIN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Giuffre family welcomes Andrew's fall from royal status but wants more action
item.description: LONDON (AP) — British politicians, the public and the family of Virginia Roberts Giuffre on Friday praised King Charles III’s decision to strip his brother Andrew of his princely title and spacious home, a banishment that has left the disgraced royal increasingly exposed to political and legal scrut
item.dc:creator: JILL LAWLESS and BRIAN MELLEY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: FBI confirms death, injury count in Michigan church shooting
item.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has confirmed the number of dead and injured in the shooting at an LDS church in Grand Blanc, Mich., in Sept.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Bittan, ABC 4

item.title: Ohio panel and Virginia lawmakers move forward with congressional redistricting plans
item.description: An Ohio panel adopted new U.S. House districts on Friday that could boost the GOP’s chances of winning two additional seats in next year’s elections and aid President Donald Trump’s efforts to hold on to a slim congressional majority.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, OLIVIA DIAZ and MARK SCOLFORO, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Death row inmate Stephen Bryant chooses firing squad execution after admitting to gruesome murder
item.description: South Carolina death row inmate Stephen Bryant chooses firing squad execution for Nov. 14, becoming the third this year to select the method.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: US Marine arrested, accused of traveling 'to meet, kidnap and sexually assault' 12-year-old girl: FBI
item.description: Active-duty Marine William Richard Roy arrested by FBI for allegedly traveling from North Carolina to Indiana to kidnap and assault a 12-year-old girl.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Judge orders Trump administration to pay SNAP benefits with emergency funds
item.description: U.S. District Judge John McConnell’s order prevents the administration from completely drying up the benefit for more than 40 million Americans.
item.dc:creator: Zach Schonfeld, NewsNation

item.title: Nation’s largest airlines press Democrats to pass funding stopgap to reopen government
item.description: Four of the nation’s largest airlines are pressing Senate Democrats to pass a clean stopgap spending bill to reopen the government amidst growing delays at airports around the country caused by staffing issues linked to the expiration of government funding a month ago.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, NewsNation

item.title: Wisconsin judge puts on hold ruling that required citizenship check of voters
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A Wisconsin judge on Friday put on hold his order that requires elections officials to verify the citizenship of all 3.6 million registered voters in the battleground state before the next statewide election in February.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: LA firefighters ordered to leave fire that exploded into Palisades Fire days later: report
item.description: Firefighter text messages reveal crews were ordered to leave the origin site of the devastating Palisades Fire despite hot tree stumps, a new report said.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: The Latest: Trump wants to scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Last-minute scramble over pay takes a toll on military families during the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The government shutdown is exacting a heavy mental toll on the nation's military families, leaving them not knowing from week to week whether their paychecks will arrive.
item.dc:creator: BEN FINLEY, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Blue state ICE agents dodge bullets, speeding cars as left ramps up tracking campaigns
item.description: ICE officers face escalating violence in California with two recent shootings. Assaults against agents up 1000% as individuals attempt to use cars as weapons.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: JetBlue flight to New Jersey makes emergency descent, injuring as many as 20 passengers
item.description: Fifteen to 20 passengers were injured on a JetBlue flight heading to Newark, New Jersey. The flight was diverted in Florida due to a control issue experienced by the flight crew, according to officials.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Euzarraga, KRON4

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and other content from YouTube TV amid breakdown in talks
item.description: YouTube TV viewers can no longer see Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after the two sides failed to agree on a new content distribution deal.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Suspect in custody after shooting at officers from inside Addison home
item.description: A suspect is in custody after he reportedly fired shots at police officers from inside an Addison home.
item.dc:creator: Ethan Illers, NewsNation

item.title: Chicago father of child fighting cancer released on bond by immigration judge
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — A Chicago man whose 16-year-old daughter is undergoing treatment for advanced cancer will be released on bond and return home, an immigration judge ruled Thursday. Attorneys for Ruben Torres Maldonado, a 40-year-old painter and home renovator who was detained Oct.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Trump appears to suggest the US will resume testing nuclear weapons for first time in 30 years
item.description: President Donald Trump appeared to suggest the U.S. will resume testing nuclear weapons for the first time in three decades, saying it would be on an “equal basis” with Russia and China.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Putin claims Russian troops have surrounded 2 Ukrainian cities but Ukraine says that's not true
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russian President Vladimir Putin claimed Wednesday that Russian troops have surrounded Ukrainian forces in two key eastern cities of Ukraine and offered to negotiate a deal for their surrender. Ukrainian military officials vigorously denied the claim.
item.dc:creator: ILLIA NOVIKOV, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Protests erupt after police raid in Brazil leaves 119 dead and draws accusations of excessive force
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — A massive police raid on a drug gang embedded in low-income neighborhoods of Rio de Janeiro that left at least 119 people dead drew protests for excessive force Wednesday and calls for the Rio’s governor to resign.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES and DIARLEI RODRIGUES, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Food aid at risk of expiring as effort to fund SNAP benefits fails in Senate
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Republican leaders in Congress said it’s all or nothing on Wednesday as they rejected a Democratic push to carve out food aid funding for more than 40 million Americans who stand to lose it as part of the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: KEVIN FREKING and MARY CLARE JALONICK, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: A man who spent 43 years in prison before his conviction was overturned now faces deportation
item.description: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — After waiting more than four decades to clear his name in a friend’s 1980 killing, Subramanyam Vedam was set to walk free from a Pennsylvania prison this month.
item.dc:creator: MARYCLAIRE DALE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Here's how tariffs could impact holiday shopping season: Analysis
item.description: If current tariffs had been in place last year, consumers would have faced a $28.6 billion burden, a new analysis finds.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dorn, WGN 9

item.title: Former ISU teacher's assistant arrested for alleged threats against Donald Trump
item.description: Derek Lopez, 27, of El Paso, was arrested by the El Paso Police Department and the FBI for allegedly making threats against President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Huslig, WGN 9

item.title: GM lays off 1,700 workers at plants in Michigan and Ohio amid slower EV demand
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — General Motors is laying off about 1,700 workers across manufacturing sites in Michigan and Ohio, as the auto giant adjusts to slowing demand for electric vehicles.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Chicago's children are getting caught in the chaos of immigration crackdowns
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — The 2-year-old boy was so frightened, he stuttered. “Mommy, mommy, mommy,” he repeated, clinging to her. His mother, Molly Kucich, had been grocery shopping when her husband called, panicking. She heard “immigration raid.” Then: “tear gas.
item.dc:creator: CLAIRE GALOFARO, Associated Press, ABC 4
